medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient had been well until 4 days before admission, when aching developed in the left elbow, which improved with ibuprofen. The next day, right elbow discomfort occurred, and he had decreased appetite. Two days before admission, he noted difficulty forming words, mild light-headedness, and mild recurrent pain in both elbows. Attempting to drink water led to a gagging sensation; breathing difficulty and inability to swallow the water developed but resolved when he spat it out. Anxiety increased, and he stopped drinking liquids. The day before admission, he was unable to shower due to anxiety and noted intermittent decreased fluency in speech and pruritus at the nape of his neck.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Hypertension, chronic ptosis of the right eyelid, previous tick bite treated with doxycycline.
medical_history.social_history: Occasional alcohol consumption, stopped smoking 25 years ago, lives with wife in an old house in a semi-rural region, no recent international travel, and has had contact with bats in the environment.
